summary: An email chain from July 2020 between FBI personnel discussing a new complaint from a woman who claims she was raped by Jeffrey Epstein in 2003 when she was 18 years old. The complainant is described as upset and nervous about divulging the information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the alleged perpetrator of rape in 2003 against an 18-year-old woman, as reported in a new complaint in 2020.

events.title: Alleged rape of 18-year-old by Epstein
events.description: A woman claims she was raped by Jeffrey Epstein in 2003 when she was 18 years old.

events.title: Complaint call received
events.description: An FBI agent receives a call from a woman claiming she was raped by Epstein in 2003.

events.title: Email coordination about complaint
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to coordinate on how to handle the new rape complaint against Epstein.

keyFacts: A new complaint was made to the FBI in July 2020 alleging Jeffrey Epstein raped a woman in 2003 when she was 18.
The complainant was described as very upset and nervous about divulging the information.
The email shows FBI personnel actively coordinating on how to handle this new allegation years after Epstein's initial investigations and death.
